title: Standard Chartered says Ether could reach $8,000 by 2026 as blockchain upgrades continue - Fortune
summary: Standard Chartered predicts Ether could reach $8,000 by 2026 as blockchain upgrades continue, despite recent lackluster performance. The bank expects Ether to eventually reach $26,000-$35,000 per token. Upgrades to the Ethereum blockchain, including "danksharding," could boost its dominance in DeFi and increase activity on the network, driving up Ether's price.

title: Ethereum Could Explode by Over 2,100%, According to $820,000,000,000 Global Bank: Report - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum could surge by over 2,100% according to Standard Chartered, one of the largest banks in the world. The bank predicts ETH will reach $35,000 after hitting $8,000 in about three years. Increasing use cases and layer-2 scaling solutions are cited as reasons for the price forecast. The bank believes gaming and tokenization of real-world assets offer significant growth potential for Ethereum. Planned upgrades to the Ethereum network in early 2024 are also seen as positive.

title: Analyst Benjamin Cowen Highlights Ethereum's Poor Performance - U.Today
summary: Ethereum's performance has been poor according to analyst Benjamin Cowen, despite popular belief. Data presented shows that Ethereum's price has dwindled from $1,804 to $1,564 since May 12th, while Bitcoin's price has remained steady at $26,800. This downtrend is reflected in the ETH/BTC ratio, which has progressively slipped from 0.067 to 0.058. Cowen notes that a holistic view paints a different picture, with Bitcoin retracting by 61% and Ethereum by 68% from their all-time highs. Current market analysis supports Cowen's stance, with Ethereum struggling at around $1,551.34 while Bitcoin maintains stability at $26,727.99. The analysis serves as a reminder to traders to delve deeper into market trends and make informed investment decisions.

title: Ethereum's Vitalik Buterin Talks Up Protocol Enshrinement - Unchained - Unchained
summary: Ethereum creator Vitalik Buterin has proposed a process called "enshrinement" to improve the security and scalability of the Ethereum blockchain by incorporating key features directly into the core protocol. This involves minimizing the impact of potential bugs and mitigating validator centralization. However, this process could result in a more complex protocol that becomes unwieldy over time. Meanwhile, similar conversations are happening in the Bitcoin community about implementing "drivechains," which are secondary blockchains that interact with the primary Bitcoin network. These technical discussions are expected to have a greater impact on the industry in the long run than high-profile trials like the one involving Sam Bankman-Fried.

title: Better Buy: Ethereum or Solana? - The Motley Fool
summary: In a recent article, The Motley Fool compares the performance of Ethereum (ETH) and Solana (SOL) in 2023. Despite Ethereum's strong performance since its merge last year, institutional investors have been moving their money into Solana, with net inflows of over $24 million in the latest weekly numbers from CoinShares. This is more than twice the amount that went into Ethereum. The article suggests that Solana's superior blockchain capabilities, including faster processing speeds and lower transaction fees, may be driving this trend. Additionally, Solana's partnership with Visa on a new stablecoin payment project may be a factor. The article concludes that Solana may be the next Ethereum and a potentially strong long-term investment.

title: Ethereum Has Nearly Cleared Out Validator Queue, a Sign of Weak Staking Demand - CoinDesk
summary: Ethereum's staking ratio has grown 22% since April, but still lags behind other popular proof-of-stake networks. The staking ratio for Solana (SOL) is 69%, while it's 63% for Cardano (ADA) and 53% for Avalanche (AVAX).

title: Ethereum's scaling infrastructure is better than ever. So where's all the traffic? - Blockworks
summary: Ethereum's scaling infrastructure has improved, but traffic remains low despite increased capacity. Layer-2 solutions have been developed to reduce network congestion, but transactions have not increased proportionally. Analysts suggest that this may be due to a temporary oversupply of scaling solutions, similar to the phenomenon of adding more lanes to a highway leading to increased traffic. The current situation is compared to the Permian Basin pipeline system in Texas, where there is more capacity than demand. Negative sentiment on social media may pressure short-term holders to sell, but long-term outlook remains optimistic as Ethereum continues to evolve and improve.

title: Crypto Venture Firm Placeholder Capital Says Ethereum and Solana Are Like Android and iOS – Here’s Why - The Daily Hodl
summary: Placeholder Capital, a prominent crypto venture capital firm, is comparing Ethereum (ETH) to Android and Solana (SOL) to iOS. They argue that Ethereum and Solana share similarities with these mobile operating systems due to their modularity and integrated ecosystems. Android allows hardware companies to bring new products to market quickly, but with a more fragmented app experience. iOS provides a more consistent user experience, capturing more value within its ecosystem. Solana offers faster and cheaper transactions than Ethereum, while Solana is more tightly integrated. The firm concludes that Ethereum's likeness to Android is helping to boost its layer-2 ecosystem, while Solana's benefits include speed and cost.

title: Ethereum Price Prediction: ETH Market Falls As Bitcoin Climbs - CoinGape
summary: Ethereum price is experiencing selling pressure and down 4.6% in a week, while Bitcoin gains traction as investors seek exposure to the most popular digital asset amid geopolitical tensions. Ethereum's market value has shrunk by 18% since June, while Bitcoin lost around half of the same amount. Ethereum's percentage of the total market capitalization has decreased to 17.9% from approximately 18.4% at the beginning of 2023. Investors are choosing Bitcoin over Ethereum as the war in the Middle East rages on, with Ethereum underperforming the broad market. The Ethereum price is holding below all bull market moving average indicators and the Relative Strength Index (RSI) reinforces the bearish outlook. Losing support at $1,550 would mean abandoning a potential trend reversal, with possible support areas at $1,450 and $1,230. An immediate recovery would be possible if bulls stand their ground at $1,550 and push to reclaim higher

title: AI Predicts Ethereum Price to Surpass $10,000 by 2028, UK Banking Giant Agrees - CoinCodex
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum price could reach $10,000 by 2028 and $35,000 by 2037, according to a price prediction algorithm and a lead researcher at Standard Chartered Bank. The reasons for the price increase include gaming, tokenization, and the launch of an Ethereum spot ETF. The price of Ethereum has been down since April, but could retest $4,000 by the end of 2024 and reach $8,000 by the end of 2026, according to Standard Chartered's head of research. An ETF could be an immediate price catalyst.

title: Cardano Founder Addresses ETHGate Rumors: Did Ethereum Bribe The SEC To Go After XRP? - NewsBTC
summary: Cardano founder Charles Hoskinson addressed rumors that the SEC gave Ethereum a regulatory free pass, suggesting that there may be unequal application of regulations but no corruption. Hoskinson, a co-founder of Ethereum, also mentioned that Himman emails and other revelations show possible wrongdoings of the SEC. Some in the crypto community criticized Hoskinson's statement, alleging that favoritism and corruption are not different. The article also mentions that Steven Nerayoff and John Deaton have made similar claims of SEC corruption regarding Ethereum.

title: Ethereum Investors Should Maintain Caution Despite $,8000 Calls - CoinGape
summary: Ethereum (ETH) investors should be cautious despite bullish predictions, as the cryptocurrency has faced selling pressure and could potentially invalidate the bullish outlook if it closes below $1,530. While some analysts, such as Ali Martinez, predict a recovery to $1,630, others, like Benjamin Cowen, forecast a decrease in value to less than $1,200 by the end of the year. Standard Chartered Bank has predicted that ETH could reach $8,000 by 2026, but JPMorgan Chase has raised concerns about diminishing network activity on the platform. Ethereum whales have continued to show support, with the top 10 largest ETH wallets adding 40 million ETH recently.

title: Machine learning algorithm sets Ethereum price for October 31, 2023 - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Machine learning algorithms predict Ethereum's price will reach $1,484.94 by October 31, 2023, with a potential decline of 4%. Another algorithm is more bullish, predicting a price of $1,784.76. Ethereum's current price is $1,546.9, down 1.45% on the day. Technical analysis gauges suggest a bearish reading for Ethereum, with a'strong sell' signal at 16. Despite this, Ethereum's long-term prospects remain promising.

title: BitVM wasn't created to make Bitcoin a pseudo-Ethereum, says developer - Cointelegraph
summary:
BitVM, a new technology aimed at scaling Bitcoin, has been making waves in the cryptocurrency community. Developers behind the project have clarified that it is not intended to launch Ethereum-like decentralized finance applications on the network, but rather to improve Bitcoin's scaling capabilities.

Super Testnet, one of the developers working on BitVM, told Cointelegraph that the technology is focused on scaling Bitcoin rather than implementing smart contracts and altcoins. He explained that the real killer app for BitVM is scaling Bitcoin to process millions of transactions per second, and that the team is not interested in bringing Ethereum's altcoins to Bitcoin.

However, Super Testnet did acknowledge that BitVM could take demand away from Ethereum's altcoins. He also emphasized that BitVM is optional, like the Lightning Network, and that users can choose to keep their assets in cold storage if they want them to be safe.

The developer also clarified that BitVM is not capable of computing "anything" yet, and that the team needs to build more primitives to make it possible. Despite this,

title: Ethereum ETF launch fizzles as traders 'distracted' by SBF trial - DLNews
summary: Ethereum ETF launches have failed to gain traction, with trading volumes only reaching 0.2% of Bitcoin ETF volumes in 2021. This contrasts with the successful launch of Bitcoin futures ETFs in 2021, which saw over $1 billion in trading volume in just two days. The slow start is attributed to a lack of institutional adoption and investor skepticism towards futures ETFs in the crypto space. Additionally, the ongoing trial of FTX co-founder Sam Bankman-Fried may be distracting traders. US inflation data released today could also contribute to the underperformance of Bitcoin and Ethereum.

title: Lido faces $35k penalty as 20 validators violate Ethereum's rules - crypto.news
summary: Lido, a decentralized finance protocol for staking cryptocurrencies, faces a $35k penalty after 20 of its validators were slashed for violating Ethereum's rules. The validators, operated by Launchnodes, are offline and investigating the root cause of the issue. Lido reassured users that they are not affected and stakers will not see reduced rewards for the day. Launchnodes has also expressed their desire to compensate stakers at the soonest possible time.

title: We Asked ChatGPT What Price Ethereum Will Hit in 2024 - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum (ETH) is down 11% in the past week and trading below key support levels. ChatGPT predicts ETH could reach $2,000-$3,000 by 2024, driven by the upcoming Bitcoin halving and increased adoption. However, the model cautions that the markets could remain challenged in the short term. Other cryptos, such as Bitcoin Minetrix (BTCMTX), are gaining attention due to their potential for growth. Bitcoin Minetrix has raised over $1.1 million in its presale and could potentially trade between $0.20-$0.40 in 2024, representing returns of 20x-40x for early investors.

title: Lido Finance Faces Slashing Penalty of More Than $30,000 in Ethereum - Decrypt
summary: Lido Finance, a leading liquid staking protocol, faces a minimum penalty of 20 Ethereum (ETH) before it can withdraw its ETH from validators that were slashed. On Wednesday, 20 validators associated with Launchnodes, one of Lido's node operators, were slashed from the Ethereum network, resulting in an initial loss of 20 ETH with additional penalties to be believed. The slashing penalty is 1/32 ETH for a maximum of 1 ETH per slashed validator, deducted and burnt immediately. Lido Finance did not immediately respond to Decrypt's request for comment. The protocol has a cover fund of approximately 6,200 ETH to help mitigate the slashing impact, but it does not trigger automatically. The community will later decide whether the cover fund should compensate affected holders.

title: Is ETH on the Verge of Breaking Below $1,500? (Ethereum Price Analysis) - CryptoPotato
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is facing a critical support test at $1,500 after a recent rejection at the 100-day moving average. Technical analysis suggests a potential break below this level could lead to sharp declines. On-chain analysis also indicates an uptick in leverage usage in the futures market, which could lead to increased volatility. If buyers can overpower sellers, a sudden reversal could occur, but a breach below $1,500 could trigger a market cascade.

title: Reddit's Fortnite BRICK Token Is Beating Bitcoin, Ethereum Today With 80% Gains: What's Happening - Nasdaq
summary: Reddit's Fortnite BRICK token has surged 80% in value in the past 24 hours, outperforming Bitcoin and Ethereum. The token, which is native to Reddit's Fortnite community, has experienced a turnaround after a significant decline in value over the past two months. Trading volume for BRICK reached nearly $649,000 on cryptocurrency exchange Kraken, with a 78% increase in trading volume compared to the previous 24-hour period. Although liquidity remains relatively thin, the recent surge in BRICK's value has sparked interest in the token. The token is primarily used as a community token within the r/FortNiteBR subreddit, where users can utilize it for various functions such as purchasing premium features and payments towards Special Membership perks. In related news, Fortnite has announced a forthcoming increase in the price of its premium in-game currency, V-Bucks, set to take effect from October 27.

title: Vitalik Buterin’s Newest Proposal Addresses Ethereum’s Decentralization Concerns - ZyCrypto
summary: Vitalik Buterin proposes a two-tiered staking system to address Ethereum's decentralization concerns. The system includes node operators who stake 32 ETH and manage tasks, and delegators who hold stakes below 32 ETH and endorse specific node operators. The proposal aims to reduce the number of signatures needed per block, enhance scalability, and fortify network security. It also unlocks innovative staking solutions through smart contracts, liquidity tokens, and other mechanisms.

title: Uniswap Launches Mobile Ethereum Wallet on Android - Decrypt
summary: Uniswap, a leading decentralized exchange, has launched a mobile crypto wallet for Android users after beta testing on iOS. The wallet offers features such as split-second swaps, easy discovery of new tokens, and transparent pricing. It also includes a new feature called "swap protection" to defend users against common DeFi exploits like sandwich and frontrunning attacks. The launch comes after a successful iOS launch and marks Uniswap's global expansion. However, the protocol has faced regulatory challenges in recent months, including a class action lawsuit that was dismissed by a New York judge.

title: Crypto Price Today: Bitcoin struggles to hold $26,500; Ethereum trades above $1,550; Altcoins mixed - Business Today
summary:
Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are experiencing a mixed day of trading, with some tokens seeing gains while others experience losses. The global cryptocurrency market cap is down slightly, trading around $1.05 trillion. Bitcoin is holding onto the $26,500 level, but there are concerns that it could fall further if buyers don't step in. Ethereum is trading above $1,550, but it too could be in danger of falling if sellers continue to pressure it. Altcoins are seeing mixed trading, with some gaining ground while others lose ground.

In other news, the Hamas terrorist organization has received millions of dollars in crypto donations, according to a report by the Wall Street Journal. This has raised concerns about the use of cryptocurrency as a means of financing militant groups.

In traditional banking news, JPMorgan's in-house blockchain Onyx has launched its tokenized collateral network. This could have implications for the broader financial industry and how it interacts with the crypto space.

Overall, the crypto market is experien

title: Standard Chartered Says Ethereum Price Can Reach $35,000, Here’s When - NewsBTC
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Standard Chartered predicts Ethereum price could reach $35,000 in the next bull market, expected between 2025-2026.

Researcher Geoff Kendrick sees Ethereum outperforming Bitcoin, with a potential 5x increase in value.

Kendrick cites use cases such as gaming and asset tokenization as drivers of growth.

Bearish predictions from another analyst suggest Ethereum could fall to $900.

Note: The article provides a disclaimer that the information is for educational purposes only and does not constitute investment advice.

title: Crypto: Ethereum on the Path to a Peak of $8,000 - Cointribune EN
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is predicted to reach $8,000 by 2026, according to a recent study by Standard Chartered Bank. Expert Geoff Kendrick attributes this growth to the expansion of Ethereum's use cases, particularly in gaming and tokenization. However, other experts, such as Benjamin Cowen, are more cautious and predict a potential drop to below $1,200. The introduction of Ether Futures ETFs has also had a negative impact on ETH. Despite these challenges, major investors remain confident in Ethereum's long-term potential, with the ten largest ETH wallets recently adding 40 million ETH. To maximize your crypto rewards, join our 'Read to Earn' program and earn points for each article you read.

title: Ethereum DeFi Protocol BarnBridge Faces SEC Action and Fines, Opens Token-Holder Voting - Cryptonews
summary: BarnBridge, an Ethereum-based DeFi protocol, is facing legal action from the SEC and has opened token-holder voting on how to respond. Token holders can vote to comply with the regulator's orders, pay fines, or authorize legal counsel to sign the final version of the SEC order. The project has been halted until further notice to reduce potential legal liability.

title: Ethereum DeFi Exchange AirSwap Rolls Out NFT Marketplace - Decrypt
summary: AirSwap, a decentralized exchange (DEX), has launched a new NFT marketplace and over-the-counter (OTC) trading features, along with voter rewards for its decentralized autonomous organization (DAO). The move aligns with AirSwap's ethos of promoting decentralized trading and NFTs, while mitigating the risks associated with centralized platforms. The updated platform also features a more robust OTC trading service and an open-source front-end for community members to adapt. AirSwap's DAO uses token-based voting to make decisions, incentivizing community members to participate in its governance. Since 2021, over 32 million AirSwap tokens have been staked to the voter rewards system, with a portion of the protocol fees going into a reward pool for active participants.

title: Ethereum Staking Frenzy Cools as Validator Backlog Reduces - Crypto Times
summary: Ethereum's staking frenzy has cooled down as the backlog of new validators awaiting activation has nearly emptied. The queue of potential validators has shrunk from 45 days in June to below 5 hours as of Thursday. While staking rewards have fallen to around 3.5%, industry analysts suggest that the emptying activation queue implies slowing growth in Ethereum's staked Ether supply. The network's breakneck pace of new validators has moderated as yields drop and investors evaluate options. Despite this, Ethereum's staking ratio has risen to 22% from 6.5% before the merger, but still lags behind other proof-of-stake chains.

title: Crypto Price Today: Bitcoin falls below $27,000; Ethereum holds above $1,550 level - The Economic Times
summary:
